Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 pushed Youth A during an escalated incident on
05/18/2024.
Investigation Attempts to contact the Complainant were made on 07/09/2024,
07/25/2024 and 07/31/2024 with no return contact.
Youth A was interviewed on 05/24/2024 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. He recalled the incident in
question. Youth A recalled that all the youth in the unit were going
into their group session, and he did not hear Staff 1 tell them to
get a notebook and pencil. He stood up to go to his room to get
one. Youth A recalled Staff 1 stepping in front of him and telling
him to stop because another youth was going to get one at that
time. Youth A recalled stating to Staff 1 “Not everything is going
to go your way” while telling him he was still going to go to his
room. Youth A recalled Staff 1 stating he was a “16 year old
juvenile” in response. Youth A stated he and Staff 1 started
arguing and Staff 1 repeatedly told him he was not going to go to
his room, and instructed Youth A to sit down. Youth A stated he
then tried moving around Staff 1 to get past him. Youth A believed
Staff 1 then shoved him first, and Youth A confirmed he shoved
Staff 1 back. He then clarified this largely occurred at the same
time. Youth A stated he then tried to fight Staff 1 and the situation
escalated physically. He recalled Staff 2 and Staff 3 getting
involved to try to stop the fighting. Youth A could not remember
specifics next but recalled he eventually went to the ground on his
back, and Staff 1 and Staff 3 were next to him. Youth A recalled
Staff 3 lifting him up off of the ground and putting his arm around
2

him and walking him out the side door of the unit. Youth A gave
credit to Staff 3 for de-escalating the situation.
Youth B was interviewed on 05/24/2024 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated he saw the beginning of
the situation and described it as Youth A trying to shove and kick
Staff 1, with Staff 1 shoving Youth A back.
Youth C was interviewed on 05/24/2024 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. He recalled being present for the
incident in question. He stated both Youth A and Staff 1 started
pushing each other simultaneously and when other staff had to
get involved, he was instructed to leave the common area of the
unit and go to his room.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone on 06/06/2024. She stated
she was present for the incident of concern. She recalled it began
with Youth A leaving the group to go back to his room, and Staff 1
stepped in between to block him. Staff 2 could not recall what
Youth A or Staff 1 said to each other. She recalled this escalated
into bumping chests and shoving quickly. Staff 2 could not recall
who put their hands on who first, but confirmed both individuals
were pushing each other. Staff 2 recalled she and Staff 3
attempting to get in between Youth A and Staff 1. She stated she
disengaged when Staff 1 and Staff 3 attempted a restraint move
with Youth A as he was throwing punches. Staff 2 recalled turning
her attention to the rest of the youth and instructing them to go to
their rooms. Staff 2 did not witness the end of the incident with
Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed over the phone on 06/06/2024. He
recalled the incident in question. Staff 3 stated he came out of the
office within the unit to hear Staff 1 tell Youth A to sit back down in
the common area of the unit. Staff 3 recalled a pushing match
beginning at that time, with Youth A initiating physical contact but
Staff 1 reciprocating by pushing back at Youth A. Staff 3 believed
Staff 1 would have had to defend himself as Youth A is large and
could hurt someone without reacting. Staff 3 recalled seeing Staff
2 get involved and he involved himself as well. Staff 3 recalled
attempting to restrain Youth A along with the help of Staff 1 but
could not recall how this occurred. He recalled Youth A falling to
the ground on his back, and Staff 3 helped pick him up and
walked him out of the side door of the unit. Staff 3 recalled Youth
A doing this voluntarily and Youth A was then able to calm down
at that point.
3

Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 06/06/2024. He
recalled that he was trying to get Youth A to wait to go down the
hallway to his room when Youth A approached him. Staff 1 stated
that this was protocol to ensure that only one youth were near the
bedrooms at a time when the rest of the group is in the separate
common area. Staff 1 stated he calmly explained this to Youth A.
Staff 1 recalled Youth A walking into his chest, and Staff 1 then
put his arms out to use proxemics and keep Youth A at a distance.
Staff 1 recalled Youth A stating he “didn't have time for that” when
being instructed to wait, and Staff 1 stating in response “I need
you to do what you need to do.” Staff 1 denied calling Youth A a
delinquent during the interaction. Staff 1 recalled Youth A
continued to escalate, bumping into his chest and eventually
pushing Staff 1 first. Staff 1 stated he pushed Youth A back. Staff
1 recalled Youth A then escalating more to throwing punches and
pushing with greater force. Staff 1 believed this was when Staff 2
and Staff 3 intervened and attempted to restrain Youth A. A few
seconds later Staff 1 stated he took Staff 2’s place in the restraint
attempt because she was smaller than him and Youth A was
escalated. Staff 1 and Staff 3 attempted a proper standing team
control restraint hold and this was immediately not effective
because of Youth A fighting back and falling to the ground. Staff 1
recalled that Staff 3 assisted Youth A back up and then took him
outside of the unit to de-escalate.
Video reviewed:
Video footage of 05/18/2024 from within the unit was reviewed on
05/24/2024. No audio was available for the footage. The
common area of the unit was in view with several youth sitting
down. Youth A was seen at the beginning of the hallway when his
path was impeded by Staff 1. They could be seen talking to each
other. Youth A attempted to step around Staff 1 and Staff 1 kept
stepping with him to not allow him to pass by. As Staff 2 is walking
past them to their left, Staff 1 can be seen raising his right arm
and making contact with the left shoulder of Youth A. Youth A
then attempted to move past Staff 1 to his right and Staff 1 and
Youth A bumped chests as described in interviews. Staff 1 then
pushed Youth A back with his right hand. Youth A attempted to
walk past Staff 1 again. Staff 1 then pushed Youth A back a
second time in a similar manner. Youth A then leaned into Staff
1’s space and the two began pushing and grappling, escalating
physically. Staff 2 and Staff 3 attempted to intervene between the
two unsuccessfully. As Youth A continued to be escalated Staff 1
and Staff 3 could be seen attempting a standing team control
restraint of Youth A. Youth A struggled during this attempt and he
and Staff 1 fell to the ground. Youth A turned to his back upon
4

landing on the ground, and then proceeded to kick up at Staff 1.
Staff 1 grabbed on to Youth A’s feet and threw them to his right
side on to the ground. Youth A then got up and while Staff 3 still
had hands on him, moved to the side of the common area room.
Staff 3 then could be seen walking Youth A out of the side door of
the unit and Youth A appeared to be de-escalating.
Documents reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file was reviewed and there was no
discipline noted. He was up to date on the training for the
facility’s approved restraint model, Nonviolent Crisis
Intervention, as of 12/21/2023.
• An Incident Report was reviewed dated 05/20/2024
describing the 05/18/2024 incident. The incident report is
largely consistent with interviews.
• Facility policies and procedures titled “Aggressive
Behavior” and “Assaultive Behavior” were reviewed. These
policies outline staff’s preventative and reactive procedures
in response to escalated behaviors from students. There
was no language in the policies that stated that pushing
was allowed.
Analysis The facility was found in non-compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, Staff 1 pushed Youth A multiple
times and threw Youth A to the side during the escalated incident
that occurred on 05/18/2024.
Consultation provided:
Consultation was provided in the area of best use of staff during
an escalated incident. This incident involved a restraint attempt
initiated by Staff 1 when Staff 1 was directly involved in the
original escalation of Youth A. In addition, staff involved felt that
Staff 2 would not be able to attempt to de-escalate the situation.
Youth A may not have been able to benefit from any staff’s de-
escalation attempts at that point but it should be considered and
explored in staff meetings and trainings how staff can avoid
situations with youth escalated specifically at them and how other
staff can assist in their stead.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
